description: Application launches successfully and displays main window
steps: Step 1: Launch the MacTheme application
Step 2: Verify main window opens within 3 seconds
Step 3: Verify window has native macOS appearance with title bar
Step 4: Verify no console errors during launch

description: Application creates required directory structure on first launch
steps: Step 1: Delete ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme directory if it exists
Step 2: Launch MacTheme application
Step 3: Verify ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/themes directory exists
Step 4: Verify ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/custom-themes directory exists
Step 5: Verify ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/current directory exists
Step 6: Verify preferences.json and state.json files are created

description: All bundled themes are installed on first launch
steps: Step 1: Launch MacTheme for the first time
Step 2: Navigate to themes directory
Step 3: Verify tokyo-night theme exists
Step 4: Verify catppuccin-mocha theme exists
Step 5: Verify catppuccin-latte theme exists
Step 6: Verify gruvbox-dark theme exists
Step 7: Verify gruvbox-light theme exists
Step 8: Verify nord theme exists
Step 9: Verify dracula theme exists
Step 10: Verify one-dark theme exists
Step 11: Verify solarized-dark theme exists
Step 12: Verify solarized-light theme exists
Step 13: Verify rose-pine theme exists

description: Each bundled theme has all required configuration files
steps: Step 1: Open tokyo-night theme directory
Step 2: Verify alacritty.toml exists
Step 3: Verify kitty.conf exists
Step 4: Verify iterm2.itermcolors exists
Step 5: Verify warp.yaml exists
Step 6: Verify hyper.js exists
Step 7: Verify vscode.json exists
Step 8: Verify neovim.lua exists
Step 9: Verify raycast.json exists
Step 10: Verify bat.conf exists
Step 11: Verify delta.gitconfig exists
Step 12: Verify starship.toml exists
Step 13: Verify zsh-theme.zsh exists
Step 14: Verify theme.json exists with valid metadata

description: Theme metadata (theme.json) is valid and complete for all bundled themes
steps: Step 1: Load tokyo-night theme.json
Step 2: Verify name, author, description, and version fields exist
Step 3: Verify colors object contains all required color properties
Step 4: Verify color values are valid hex codes
Step 5: Repeat verification for all 11 bundled themes

description: Sidebar navigation displays all main sections
steps: Step 1: Launch MacTheme application
Step 2: Verify sidebar is visible on the left side
Step 3: Verify 'Themes' navigation item exists
Step 4: Verify 'Editor' navigation item exists
Step 5: Verify 'Apps' navigation item exists
Step 6: Verify 'Wallpapers' navigation item exists
Step 7: Verify 'Settings' navigation item exists

description: Clicking sidebar items navigates to correct views
steps: Step 1: Launch MacTheme application
Step 2: Click 'Themes' in sidebar
Step 3: Verify theme grid view is displayed
Step 4: Click 'Editor' in sidebar
Step 5: Verify theme editor view is displayed
Step 6: Click 'Apps' in sidebar
Step 7: Verify applications manager view is displayed

description: Theme grid displays all available themes
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Verify theme grid is visible
Step 3: Count theme cards displayed
Step 4: Verify count matches number of installed themes (11 bundled + any custom)

description: Theme cards display correct information
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Select a theme card
Step 3: Verify theme name is displayed
Step 4: Verify color palette preview shows 5-6 swatches
Step 5: Verify light/dark mode badge is present
Step 6: Verify Apply button is visible
Step 7: Verify Favorite star icon is visible

description: Clicking a theme card's Apply button switches to that theme
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Note current active theme
Step 3: Click Apply button on a different theme card
Step 4: Verify theme switching notification appears
Step 5: Verify the clicked theme is now marked as active
Step 6: Verify symlink at ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/current/theme points to new theme

description: Theme symlink is created and points to correct directory
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Apply tokyo-night theme
Step 3: Check symlink at ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/current/theme
Step 4: Verify it points to ../themes/tokyo-night
Step 5: Verify symlink is readable and accessible

description: Applying a theme updates state.json correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Apply catppuccin-mocha theme
Step 3: Read ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/state.json
Step 4: Verify currentTheme field is 'catppuccin-mocha'
Step 5: Verify lastSwitched timestamp is recent (within last minute)

description: Theme search functionality filters themes by name
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Locate search bar at top of view
Step 3: Type 'cat' into search bar
Step 4: Verify only catppuccin themes are displayed
Step 5: Clear search
Step 6: Verify all themes reappear

description: Theme filter chips filter by light/dark mode
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Verify filter chips are visible (All, Light, Dark, Favorites)
Step 3: Click 'Dark' filter chip
Step 4: Verify only dark themes are displayed
Step 5: Click 'Light' filter chip
Step 6: Verify only light themes are displayed

description: Favorites filter shows only favorited themes
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Click favorite star on tokyo-night theme
Step 3: Click favorite star on nord theme
Step 4: Click 'Favorites' filter chip
Step 5: Verify only tokyo-night and nord themes are displayed

description: Clicking favorite star toggles favorite status
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Click favorite star on a theme
Step 3: Verify star icon changes to filled/highlighted state
Step 4: Click favorite star again
Step 5: Verify star icon returns to unfilled/unhighlighted state

description: Favorite themes are persisted in preferences.json
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Mark tokyo-night as favorite
Step 3: Mark gruvbox-dark as favorite
Step 4: Read ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/preferences.json
Step 5: Verify favorites array contains 'tokyo-night' and 'gruvbox-dark'
Step 6: Restart application
Step 7: Verify favorite stars are still filled for these themes

description: Clicking a theme card opens theme detail modal
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Click on a theme card (not the Apply button)
Step 3: Verify modal overlay appears
Step 4: Verify modal displays theme details
Step 5: Click outside modal or close button
Step 6: Verify modal closes

description: Theme detail modal displays full color palette
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Themes view
Step 2: Open theme detail modal for tokyo-night
Step 3: Verify color palette section is visible
Step 4: Verify all color properties from theme.json are displayed
Step 5: Verify each color shows label and hex value
Step 6: Verify color swatches match hex values visually

description: Clicking a color in theme detail modal copies hex value to clipboard
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal
Step 2: Click on a color swatch
Step 3: Verify tooltip or notification shows 'Copied to clipboard'
Step 4: Paste clipboard contents
Step 5: Verify pasted value is the correct hex code

description: Theme detail modal shows terminal preview
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal
Step 2: Locate terminal preview section
Step 3: Verify mock terminal output is displayed
Step 4: Verify terminal colors match theme palette
Step 5: Verify sample commands and output are readable

description: Theme detail modal shows code editor preview
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal
Step 2: Locate code editor preview section
Step 3: Verify syntax-highlighted code sample is displayed
Step 4: Verify syntax highlighting uses theme colors
Step 5: Verify code is readable and well-formatted

description: Theme detail modal shows wallpaper thumbnails if available
steps: Step 1: Select a theme that includes wallpapers
Step 2: Open theme detail modal
Step 3: Scroll to wallpaper section
Step 4: Verify wallpaper thumbnails are displayed
Step 5: Verify clicking a thumbnail shows larger preview

description: Apply button in theme detail modal switches to theme
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal for a non-active theme
Step 2: Click Apply button in modal
Step 3: Verify theme switching notification appears
Step 4: Verify modal closes after applying
Step 5: Verify theme is now marked as active in grid

description: Edit button in theme detail modal opens theme editor
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal
Step 2: Click Edit button
Step 3: Verify navigation to Editor view
Step 4: Verify editor is pre-populated with selected theme's colors

description: Theme Editor view displays color palette editor
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Verify color palette editor section is visible on left
Step 3: Verify live preview section is visible on right
Step 4: Verify all color properties have editable inputs

description: Clicking a color input opens color picker
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Click on background color input
Step 3: Verify color picker popover opens
Step 4: Verify color picker shows current color
Step 5: Verify color picker has hue, saturation, and brightness controls

description: Changing a color in editor updates live preview immediately
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Open color picker for background color
Step 3: Select a new color
Step 4: Verify live preview on right updates instantly
Step 5: Verify preview reflects new background color

description: Theme editor displays theme metadata form
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Scroll to metadata section
Step 3: Verify theme name input field exists
Step 4: Verify author input field exists
Step 5: Verify description textarea exists
Step 6: Verify version input field exists

description: Save button in theme editor creates new custom theme
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Modify some colors
Step 3: Enter theme name 'My Custom Theme'
Step 4: Enter author name
Step 5: Click Save button
Step 6: Verify success notification appears
Step 7: Navigate to Themes view
Step 8: Verify 'My Custom Theme' appears in grid

description: Custom theme is saved in custom-themes directory
steps: Step 1: Create a custom theme named 'test-theme'
Step 2: Save the theme
Step 3: Check ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/custom-themes/
Step 4: Verify test-theme directory exists
Step 5: Verify theme.json exists in directory
Step 6: Verify all config files were generated

description: Custom theme generation creates valid Alacritty config
steps: Step 1: Create custom theme with specific colors
Step 2: Save theme
Step 3: Open custom-themes/[theme-name]/alacritty.toml
Step 4: Verify TOML syntax is valid
Step 5: Verify colors section contains all palette colors
Step 6: Verify color values match theme.json

description: Custom theme generation creates valid Kitty config
steps: Step 1: Create custom theme
Step 2: Open custom-themes/[theme-name]/kitty.conf
Step 3: Verify config syntax is valid
Step 4: Verify color settings match theme palette

description: Custom theme generation creates valid iTerm2 colors file
steps: Step 1: Create custom theme
Step 2: Open custom-themes/[theme-name]/iterm2.itermcolors
Step 3: Verify XML plist format is valid
Step 4: Verify all color keys are present
Step 5: Verify RGB values are correct

description: Custom theme generation creates valid VS Code theme
steps: Step 1: Create custom theme
Step 2: Open custom-themes/[theme-name]/vscode.json
Step 3: Verify JSON syntax is valid
Step 4: Verify workbench color customizations are present
Step 5: Verify colors match theme palette

description: Custom theme generation creates valid Neovim Lua config
steps: Step 1: Create custom theme
Step 2: Open custom-themes/[theme-name]/neovim.lua
Step 3: Verify Lua syntax is valid
Step 4: Verify highlight groups are defined
Step 5: Verify colors match theme palette

description: Editing a built-in theme creates a copy in custom-themes
steps: Step 1: Open tokyo-night theme in editor
Step 2: Modify a color
Step 3: Click Save
Step 4: Verify app prompts to save as new custom theme
Step 5: Save with new name
Step 6: Verify tokyo-night original is unchanged
Step 7: Verify new custom theme exists in custom-themes

description: Theme editor has preset color schemes to start from
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Locate preset/template selector
Step 3: Verify multiple preset options are available
Step 4: Select a preset
Step 5: Verify color palette is populated with preset colors

description: Cancel button in theme editor discards unsaved changes
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Editor view
Step 2: Modify several colors
Step 3: Click Cancel button
Step 4: Verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 5: Confirm cancellation
Step 6: Verify changes are discarded
Step 7: Verify editor returns to clean state

description: Applications view lists all supported applications
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Verify application list is displayed
Step 3: Count terminal applications (Alacritty, Kitty, iTerm2, Warp, Hyper)
Step 4: Count editor applications (VS Code, Neovim, Sublime Text)
Step 5: Count CLI tools (bat, delta, starship, zsh, fzf, lazygit)
Step 6: Count launchers (Raycast, Alfred)
Step 7: Verify total matches specification

description: Application detection identifies installed apps
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Trigger app detection scan
Step 3: For each supported app, verify installation status is displayed
Step 4: Verify 'Installed' badge for apps that exist on system
Step 5: Verify 'Not Found' badge for apps not installed

description: Application integration status shows configuration state
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Find an installed application
Step 3: Verify integration status is shown (Configured, Needs Setup)
Step 4: For configured app, verify checkmark or confirmation indicator
Step 5: For unconfigured app, verify setup button is available

description: Toggle switch in Apps view enables/disables app theming
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Find an installed application
Step 3: Click toggle switch to disable theming
Step 4: Verify switch moves to off position
Step 5: Apply a theme
Step 6: Verify this app's config is not updated
Step 7: Enable toggle again
Step 8: Verify toggle returns to on position

description: Enabled apps preference is persisted to preferences.json
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Disable theming for Alacritty
Step 3: Disable theming for VS Code
Step 4: Read preferences.json
Step 5: Verify enabledApps array excludes 'alacritty' and 'vscode'
Step 6: Restart application
Step 7: Verify toggles remain in disabled state

description: Setup button for unconfigured app opens setup wizard
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Apps view
Step 2: Find an app marked 'Needs Setup'
Step 3: Click Setup button
Step 4: Verify setup wizard modal opens
Step 5: Verify wizard shows instructions for configuring the app

description: Setup wizard displays correct import statement for Alacritty
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for Alacritty
Step 2: Verify instructions show TOML import syntax
Step 3: Verify path shown is ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/current/theme/alacritty.toml
Step 4: Verify copy button exists to copy import statement

description: Setup wizard displays correct import statement for Kitty
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for Kitty
Step 2: Verify instructions show include directive syntax
Step 3: Verify path shown is correct for Kitty
Step 4: Verify instructions explain where to add the line

description: Setup wizard displays correct import statement for Neovim
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for Neovim
Step 2: Verify instructions show Lua dofile syntax
Step 3: Verify path uses vim.fn.expand properly
Step 4: Verify instructions explain where to add the code

description: Copy button in setup wizard copies import statement to clipboard
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for any app
Step 2: Click copy button next to import statement
Step 3: Verify tooltip shows 'Copied!'
Step 4: Paste clipboard contents
Step 5: Verify pasted text matches import statement

description: Automatic setup button in wizard adds import to config file
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for Alacritty
Step 2: Verify 'Automatic Setup' button is available
Step 3: Click automatic setup button
Step 4: Verify app asks for confirmation
Step 5: Confirm setup
Step 6: Verify ~/.config/alacritty/alacritty.toml is modified
Step 7: Verify import statement is added to file

description: Setup wizard marks app as configured after successful setup
steps: Step 1: Open setup wizard for an unconfigured app
Step 2: Complete setup (manual or automatic)
Step 3: Close wizard
Step 4: Verify app's integration status changes to 'Configured'
Step 5: Verify setup button is replaced with checkmark or similar indicator

description: Wallpapers view displays available wallpapers for current theme
steps: Step 1: Apply a theme that includes wallpapers
Step 2: Navigate to Wallpapers view
Step 3: Verify wallpaper gallery is displayed
Step 4: Verify wallpaper thumbnails are shown in grid
Step 5: Count displayed wallpapers matches theme's wallpapers directory

description: Clicking a wallpaper thumbnail shows larger preview
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Wallpapers view with theme that has wallpapers
Step 2: Click on a wallpaper thumbnail
Step 3: Verify larger preview modal opens
Step 4: Verify wallpaper is displayed at higher resolution
Step 5: Verify Apply button is visible in preview

description: Apply button in wallpaper preview sets desktop wallpaper
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Wallpapers view
Step 2: Open wallpaper preview
Step 3: Click Apply button
Step 4: Verify confirmation notification appears
Step 5: Check macOS desktop
Step 6: Verify wallpaper has been changed to selected image

description: Wallpaper application uses osascript to set macOS wallpaper
steps: Step 1: Apply a wallpaper from a theme
Step 2: Verify osascript command is executed
Step 3: Verify no errors are thrown
Step 4: Verify wallpaper changes on all displays or selected display

description: Wallpaper selection is persisted in state.json
steps: Step 1: Apply a specific wallpaper
Step 2: Read state.json
Step 3: Verify currentWallpaper field contains path to selected wallpaper
Step 4: Restart application
Step 5: Verify selected wallpaper is marked as active

description: Wallpaper symlink is created when wallpaper is applied
steps: Step 1: Apply a wallpaper
Step 2: Check ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/current/wallpaper symlink
Step 3: Verify symlink exists
Step 4: Verify symlink points to selected wallpaper in theme directory

description: Multi-display support allows different wallpapers per display
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Wallpapers view on system with multiple displays
Step 2: Verify display selector is available
Step 3: Select Display 1 from dropdown
Step 4: Apply wallpaper A
Step 5: Select Display 2 from dropdown
Step 6: Apply wallpaper B
Step 7: Verify Display 1 shows wallpaper A
Step 8: Verify Display 2 shows wallpaper B

description: Settings view displays all preference sections
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings view
Step 2: Verify 'General' section exists
Step 3: Verify 'Shortcuts' section exists
Step 4: Verify 'Auto-Switching' section exists
Step 5: Verify 'Notifications' section exists
Step 6: Verify 'Backup & Restore' section exists

description: Start at login preference can be toggled
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > General
Step 2: Locate 'Start at login' toggle
Step 3: Click toggle to enable
Step 4: Verify toggle switches to on state
Step 5: Verify preference is saved to preferences.json
Step 6: Toggle off
Step 7: Verify toggle switches to off state

description: Show in menu bar preference can be toggled
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > General
Step 2: Locate 'Show in menu bar' toggle
Step 3: Enable toggle
Step 4: Verify menu bar icon appears
Step 5: Disable toggle
Step 6: Verify menu bar icon disappears

description: Auto-switching based on system appearance can be enabled
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Auto-Switching
Step 2: Enable 'Match system appearance' toggle
Step 3: Select default light theme from dropdown
Step 4: Select default dark theme from dropdown
Step 5: Save settings
Step 6: Change macOS to dark mode
Step 7: Verify selected dark theme is applied automatically
Step 8: Change macOS to light mode
Step 9: Verify selected light theme is applied automatically

description: Default light and dark themes are saved in preferences
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Auto-Switching
Step 2: Select 'catppuccin-latte' as light theme
Step 3: Select 'catppuccin-mocha' as dark theme
Step 4: Save settings
Step 5: Read preferences.json
Step 6: Verify defaultLightTheme is 'catppuccin-latte'
Step 7: Verify defaultDarkTheme is 'catppuccin-mocha'

description: System appearance change detection works correctly
steps: Step 1: Enable auto-switching based on system appearance
Step 2: Set light and dark default themes
Step 3: Application subscribes to system appearance changes
Step 4: Change macOS appearance to dark
Step 5: Verify app receives appearance change event within 2 seconds
Step 6: Verify dark theme is applied automatically

description: Schedule-based theme switching can be configured
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Auto-Switching
Step 2: Select 'Schedule' mode
Step 3: Set light theme time to 06:00
Step 4: Set dark theme time to 18:00
Step 5: Save settings
Step 6: Verify schedule is saved in preferences.json

description: Scheduled theme switching executes at correct times
steps: Step 1: Enable schedule-based auto-switching
Step 2: Set current time to 1 minute before scheduled switch
Step 3: Wait for schedule time
Step 4: Verify theme switches automatically at scheduled time
Step 5: Verify notification appears for scheduled switch

description: Sunrise/sunset auto-switching can be enabled
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Auto-Switching
Step 2: Select 'Sunrise/Sunset' mode
Step 3: Grant location permissions if prompted
Step 4: Verify sunrise and sunset times are calculated and displayed
Step 5: Save settings

description: Keyboard shortcuts can be customized
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Shortcuts
Step 2: Locate quick switcher shortcut setting
Step 3: Click on shortcut input field
Step 4: Press new key combination (e.g., Cmd+Option+T)
Step 5: Verify shortcut is updated
Step 6: Test new shortcut works to open quick switcher

description: Notification preferences can be configured
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Notifications
Step 2: Toggle 'Show notifications on theme change'
Step 3: Toggle 'Show notifications on scheduled switch'
Step 4: Save settings
Step 5: Apply a theme
Step 6: Verify notification behavior matches preferences

description: Export themes functionality creates shareable file
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Backup & Restore
Step 2: Click 'Export Themes' button
Step 3: Select themes to export in dialog
Step 4: Choose export location
Step 5: Click Export
Step 6: Verify .mactheme or .zip file is created
Step 7: Verify exported file contains theme directories and metadata

description: Import themes functionality loads themes from file
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Backup & Restore
Step 2: Click 'Import Themes' button
Step 3: Select a previously exported theme file
Step 4: Click Import
Step 5: Verify success notification appears
Step 6: Navigate to Themes view
Step 7: Verify imported themes appear in grid

description: Imported themes are saved to custom-themes directory
steps: Step 1: Import a theme file
Step 2: Check ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/custom-themes/
Step 3: Verify imported theme directories exist
Step 4: Verify all config files are present in imported themes

description: Backup preferences creates JSON export of all settings
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Backup & Restore
Step 2: Click 'Backup Preferences' button
Step 3: Choose save location
Step 4: Save backup file
Step 5: Open backup file
Step 6: Verify it contains all preferences from preferences.json

description: Restore preferences loads settings from backup file
steps: Step 1: Create backup of current preferences
Step 2: Modify several settings
Step 3: Navigate to Settings > Backup & Restore
Step 4: Click 'Restore Preferences' button
Step 5: Select backup file
Step 6: Click Restore
Step 7: Verify settings return to backed-up state

description: Menu bar icon appears when enabled
steps: Step 1: Enable 'Show in menu bar' in Settings
Step 2: Look at macOS menu bar
Step 3: Verify MacTheme icon is visible
Step 4: Verify icon color reflects current theme's accent color

description: Clicking menu bar icon shows dropdown menu
steps: Step 1: Enable menu bar icon
Step 2: Click on menu bar icon
Step 3: Verify dropdown menu appears
Step 4: Verify menu contains recent themes list
Step 5: Verify menu contains 'Open MacTheme' option
Step 6: Verify menu contains 'Preferences' option
Step 7: Verify menu contains 'Quit' option

description: Recent themes in menu bar dropdown can be clicked to apply
steps: Step 1: Apply several different themes to populate recent list
Step 2: Click menu bar icon
Step 3: Verify recent themes are listed
Step 4: Click on a recent theme
Step 5: Verify theme is applied immediately
Step 6: Verify notification appears

description: Recent themes list is limited to 5 most recent
steps: Step 1: Apply 10 different themes sequentially
Step 2: Click menu bar icon
Step 3: Count themes in recent list
Step 4: Verify only 5 themes are shown
Step 5: Verify they are the 5 most recently applied themes in order

description: Recent themes are persisted in preferences.json
steps: Step 1: Apply tokyo-night theme
Step 2: Apply nord theme
Step 3: Apply dracula theme
Step 4: Read preferences.json
Step 5: Verify recentThemes array contains these three themes in reverse chronological order

description: Quick switcher opens with global keyboard shortcut
steps: Step 1: Verify quick switcher is not open
Step 2: Press Cmd+Shift+T (or configured shortcut)
Step 3: Verify quick switcher overlay appears
Step 4: Verify overlay appears centered on screen
Step 5: Verify overlay has semi-transparent background

description: Quick switcher displays search input and theme list
steps: Step 1: Open quick switcher
Step 2: Verify search input is focused and ready for typing
Step 3: Verify theme list is displayed below search
Step 4: Verify favorites are shown at top of list
Step 5: Verify recent themes are shown next

description: Quick switcher fuzzy search filters themes
steps: Step 1: Open quick switcher
Step 2: Type 'cat' in search
Step 3: Verify only catppuccin themes are shown
Step 4: Clear and type 'dark'
Step 5: Verify themes with 'dark' in name or tag are shown

description: Quick switcher shows preview on hover
steps: Step 1: Open quick switcher
Step 2: Hover over a theme in the list
Step 3: Verify preview panel appears showing theme colors
Step 4: Hover over different theme
Step 5: Verify preview updates to new theme

description: Pressing Enter in quick switcher applies selected theme
steps: Step 1: Open quick switcher
Step 2: Use arrow keys to select a theme
Step 3: Press Enter
Step 4: Verify theme is applied
Step 5: Verify quick switcher closes
Step 6: Verify notification appears

description: Pressing Escape closes quick switcher without applying
steps: Step 1: Open quick switcher
Step 2: Select a different theme than current
Step 3: Press Escape
Step 4: Verify quick switcher closes
Step 5: Verify theme was not changed

description: Global keyboard shortcut works even when app is minimized
steps: Step 1: Launch MacTheme application
Step 2: Minimize the window or close it to tray
Step 3: Press Cmd+Shift+T
Step 4: Verify quick switcher appears
Step 5: Verify quick switcher is functional

description: Theme switching sends notification to terminals for reload
steps: Step 1: Have Kitty terminal open and configured
Step 2: Apply a different theme in MacTheme
Step 3: Verify Kitty receives reload command (kitty @ set-colors)
Step 4: Verify Kitty terminal colors update immediately

description: VS Code settings.json is updated when theme is applied
steps: Step 1: Enable VS Code in Applications manager
Step 2: Apply tokyo-night theme
Step 3: Open ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
Step 4: Verify workbench.colorTheme is updated
Step 5: Open VS Code
Step 6: Verify theme matches applied theme

description: Theme application runs user-defined hook script if configured
steps: Step 1: Create a test hook script at ~/Library/Application Support/MacTheme/hook.sh
Step 2: Configure hook script path in preferences
Step 3: Make hook script executable
Step 4: Apply a theme
Step 5: Verify hook script is executed
Step 6: Verify hook script receives theme name as argument

description: Delete custom theme removes it from custom-themes directory
steps: Step 1: Create a custom theme
Step 2: Navigate to Themes view
Step 3: Open theme detail modal for custom theme
Step 4: Click Delete button
Step 5: Confirm deletion in dialog
Step 6: Verify theme disappears from grid
Step 7: Verify theme directory is removed from custom-themes

description: Built-in themes cannot be deleted
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal for tokyo-night (built-in theme)
Step 2: Verify Delete button is not present or is disabled
Step 3: Attempt to delete via any other method
Step 4: Verify error message explaining built-in themes cannot be deleted

description: Duplicate theme creates copy in custom-themes
steps: Step 1: Open theme detail modal for a built-in theme
Step 2: Click Duplicate button
Step 3: Enter new name for duplicate
Step 4: Click Create
Step 5: Verify new custom theme appears in Themes grid
Step 6: Verify copy exists in custom-themes directory
Step 7: Verify all config files are copied

description: IPC channel theme:list returns all available themes
steps: Step 1: Call IPC channel 'theme:list' from renderer process
Step 2: Verify response contains array of themes
Step 3: Verify each theme has required properties (name, author, colors, etc.)
Step 4: Verify bundled themes are included
Step 5: Verify custom themes are included

description: IPC channel theme:get returns specific theme data
steps: Step 1: Call IPC channel 'theme:get' with theme name 'tokyo-night'
Step 2: Verify response contains complete theme data
Step 3: Verify theme.json contents are returned
